title: The student new to the subject may be daunted - and reasonably so - by the vast wealth of literature on Roman religion. The following is intended as a brief entree. Broad and accessible introductions are provided by R

The established heavyweights on the subject are still worth dipping into: W. Warde Fowler The Religious Experience of the Roman People (London, 1911) and, for students with German, G
